rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a single British Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a single British Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a single British Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a double British Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a double British Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a double British Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a triple British Bunny. Players with this bunny in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a triple British Bunny. Players with this bunny in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a triple British Bunny. Players with this bunny in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Choose A Carrot may be used once by a player to choose a Carrot from any Kaballa's Market.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Choose 2 Carrots if you were born in the United Kingdom.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Carrots are selected from those available at any Kaballa's Market and may be chosen even when both Kaballa's Markets are closed.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Choose A Carrot cards may be used by a bunny with The Heavenly Halo or Angel Wings (Conquest Blue).

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: When the last Carrot has been taken from any Kaballa's Market, the game is over and the Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: If a player's only bunny is in space (abducted by the Beyea Aliens), it may not be used to Choose A Carrot.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: A player with Pawns but no bunnies in The Bunny Circle must discard Choose A Carrot.

title: Choose A Carrot - Greenwich Mean Time

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Choose A Carrot - Greenwich Mean Time may be used once by a player to choose a number of Carrots equal to the current time in London (01 - 12 AM/PM scale) minus the number rolled on the Orange die.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: For example, if it is 8PM in London (Greenwich Mean Time) and Carol rolled a 3 on the Orange die, then she may choose five Carrots.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: However, no player may choose more than half of the remaining Carrots at any Kaballa's Market.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: In our example, if there are only four Carrots remaining, then Carol may only choose two.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: If the current time in London minus the number rolled on the Orange die is a negative number, then the player must return Carrots equal to the negative number. Remember, when flipped from the Top Run position, no player must play any RUN card. If the current time in London is numerically low, then the player may want to discard this Choose A Carrot card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Random FTB (Feed The Bunny) may be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts rolled by the end of its next turn or die. The owner of the targeted bunny rolls for the amounts (including any re-rolls with appropriate Pawns).

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: The Green die roll determines the number of Cabbage Units, and the Blue die roll determines the number of Water Units.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: The Green die roll determines the number of Radish Units, and the Blue die roll determines the number of Milk Units.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Soggy Bottom may be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 13 to survive.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Canary Worf may be used once by a player to eliminate Soggy Bottom.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Tipsy Phone Boxes may be placed any any bunny which must roll higher than 15 to survive.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Canary Worf may be used once by a player to eliminate Tipsy Phone Boxes.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Dodgy Bangers may be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 17 to survive.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Canary Worf may be used once by a player to eliminate Dodgy Bangers.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Daleks may be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 19 to survive.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Canary Worf may be used once by a player to eliminate Daleks.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Day Trippers must be placed on a vacant Bunderground Station (any color and any number) to start. If there are no vacant Bunderground Stations in The Bunny Circle, then Day Trippers is discarded. Day Trippers is a double Red bunny that roams to the next vacant Bunderground Station numerically every round of play.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Like all Roaming Red Run cards, Day Trippers will move at the end of the turn of the player who introduced it to The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: When Day Trippers reaches the highest numbered Bunderground Station in a line, it continues to the lowest number in any line.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Day Trippers' movement to the next Bunderground Station is not affected by any Barrier.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Day Trippers is a double Red bunny and may be combined with another Red (or half Red) bunny to form a Bunny Triplet.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Day Trippers may be targeted by any Weapon card or card that affects a bunny.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Day Trippers has a built in Oyster Cracker.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Didn't Mind The Gap may be used once to eliminate any bunny on a Bunderground Station.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Elephant And Castle allows a player to roll the die and to take the same number of Bunderground Station cards from the top 50 cards of the Draw Pile if the number rolled appears as the current date (day or month).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Keep Calm And Bunny On may be used once by a player with no bunnies in The Bunny Circle, to take any one bunny from the Discard Pile and to place it into his area of The Bunny Circle or may be used once by a player to eliminate (discard) all of any one player's Bunderground Station cards. Any bunny on a Bunderground Station is simply placed into the same position in The Bunny Circle where the Bunderground Station was removed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: MI6 may be used once by a player to rearrange the top 20 cards of the Draw Pile.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Mushy Peas may be used once by a player to immediately use any number of the P-Cards saved by all of his opponents. At the end of the player's turn, any P-Cards that he chose not to use will remain with their original owners.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Mushy Peas does not have a Yellow Ball with a Red Stripe on it.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Number Wang may be used by a player who starts by shouting (out loud) the Card Identification Number (CIN) at the bottom of one of the cards in his five-card hand. The card is placed face up on the table and cannot be used again for Number Wang. Any other player may read a CIN from one of the cards in his five-card hand that starts with the last digit of the previous card's number. This process continues until no player can or wishes to play another card. The last player to read a CIN may choose three Carrots. All cards played for Number Wang are discarded and all players must draw new cards to replace the ones that were used during Number Wang.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: When reading a CIN from one of the cards in his five-card hand that starts with the last digit of the previous card's number, a player may start with the leading zero (cards 0001 to 0999) or the first non-zero digit. For example, card number 0677 Platinum Rosebud (Onyx) may 'start' with either a 0 or a 6.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Oyster Cracker - Bunny Modifier may be placed under any bunny and may force that bunny to move to a vacant Bunderground Station when that Bunderground Station in activated. A Bunderground Station is activated when any player rolls a die with a matching color and number. When this happens, the player whose area of The Bunny Circle contains the Bunderground Station may re-position any bunny in The Bunny Circle with an Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier onto the matching Bunderground Station.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Oyster Cracker - Bunny Modifier may be placed under any bunny and may force that bunny to move to a vacant Bunderground Station when that Bunderground Station in activated. A Bunderground Station is activated when any player rolls a die with a matching color and number. When this happens, the player whose area of The Bunny Circle contains the Bunderground Station may re-position any bunny in The Bunny Circle with an Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier onto the matching Bunderground Station.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Oyster Cracker - Bunny Modifier may be placed under any bunny and may force that bunny to move to a vacant Bunderground Station when that Bunderground Station in activated. A Bunderground Station is activated when any player rolls a die with a matching color and number. When this happens, the player whose area of The Bunny Circle contains the Bunderground Station may re-position any bunny in The Bunny Circle with an Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier onto the matching Bunderground Station.

title: Queen To Queen's Level Three - British Bunny Modifier

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Queen To Queen's Level Three may be placed under any single or double British Bunny in The Bunny Circle turning it into a Bunny Triplet.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Any player with the four saved Carrots that spell out I-Z-A-R (Carrot I, Carrot Z, Carrot A and Carrot R) may take Queen To Queen's Level Three and re-position it under any bunny in The Bunny Circle turning it into a Bunny Triplet.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: 6's And 7's allows a player to steal one bunny, Carrot, Zodiac, Mysterious Place, Bunderground Station, Atomic Pastry and Relative from each player if a 6 or a 7 is rolled on every die. Each die may be rolled three times.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: If the player using 6's And 7's also has The White Stuff (White) saved, that player may only roll and substitute the White die (White) once during 6's And 7's (the other three dice can be rolled up to three times each, but once the White die is substituted for another die, the White die may not be rolled or substituted again).

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: If the player using 6's And 7's has a Pawn, the player may re-roll for each time that the corresponding color die is rolled, for a total of up to six rolls.

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: For Alliteration Situation (Onyx), 6's And 7's begins with the letter "S" since "Six" begins with "S."

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Station Snatch may be used once by a player to roll the die and to snatch any one Bunderground Station with the same number rolled (any line). The Bunderground Station may be placed into any player's area of The Bunny Circle. If the Bunderground Station had a bunny on it, then the bunny will remain with the Bunderground Station in its new position.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Tower Bridge may be used once by placing the Tower Bridge over any two adjacent bunnies owned by the same player. After two rounds of play, the player may take any one British Bunny from the Discard Pile and place it immediately between the two bunnies connected by Tower Bridge. Once the British Bunny is placed into The Bunny Circle, Tower Bridge is discarded. If, however, either of the two bunnies is eliminated (discarded) before the end of the two rounds of play, then Tower Bridge is also discarded.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Two-Day Pass may be used once by a player to force any opponent to exchange two of his Bunderground Station cards in The Bunny Circle for one of yours.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Weakest Link may be used by the player with the least number of bunnies and Carrot combined to take either bunnies from the Discard Pile, Carrots from any Kaballa's Market or a combination of both until he has one more than the player with the next least amount combined.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: The player with Double Decker Bus saved may choose a Carrot every time that he rolls doubles (two identical numbers) on any combination of dice as a consequence of any card that requires the player to roll two (or more) dice. If at any time the player has no bunnies in The Bunny Circle then Double Decker Bus is discarded.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Canary Worf may be used once by a player to eliminate either Daleks, Dodgy Bangers, Soggy Bottom or Tipsy Phone Boxes. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Trafalgar Square may be used once by a player to remove up to three bunnies on three occupied Bunderground Station cards and to place them anywhere in The Bunny Circle at the end of any player's turn when that player rolls a 1-4-9 as the final values on any combination of dice. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Tube Delay may be used once by a player to delay one of his bunnies with an Oyster Cracker from moving to a Bunderground Station until the end of his next turn. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: While busking for pounds on the London Bunderground one of your bunnies is trampled by cavalier commuters!

rules.title: Additional rules
rules.text: Terrible Misfortune - Busking may only be given to a bunny on a Bunderground Station.

rules.title: Exchange Rate
rules.text: One Pound Sterling equals exactly one Kaballa Dolla

rules.title: Exchange Rate
rules.text: One Pound Sterling equals exactly one Kaballa Dolla

rules.title: Exchange Rate
rules.text: One Pound Sterling equals exactly one Kaballa Dolla

rules.title: Exchange Rate
rules.text: One Pound Sterling equals exactly one Kaballa Dolla

title: Sarsen's Corner - Red Line Bunderground Station #01

rules.title: Bunderground Station
rules.text:
When a Bundergound Station card is drawn, it is immediately placed into any player's area of The Bunny Circle. Usually a player will place it into his own area of The Bunny Circle, but a player may chose to place it into an opponent;'s area. A Bunderground Station does not count as a 'space' in The Bunny Circle, and weapons that affect adjacent bunnies to not 'see' a Bunderground Station. A Bunderground Station cannot be directly targeted by a weapon.

Every Bundergound Station has a color (or line) and a number. Each time that the die with the corresponding color is rolled, all players must check to see if a Bunderground Station located in their area of The Gunny Circle has the matching number. If it does, then the player may move any bunny with an Oyster Cracker or an Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier card from any position in The Bunny Circle and place it onto the matching (color and number) Bunderground Station.

A Bundergound Station must be vacant to receive a new bunny. A bunny already on a Bunderground Station cannot be exchanged for a new one. A bunny on a Bunderground Station counts as a 'space' in The Bunny Circle. A bunny on a Bunderground Station may be directly targeted by any weapon, and weapons that affect adjacent bunnies can 'see' these bunnies. A player may move a bunny that is already on a Bunderground Station to a vacant Bunderground Station. All bunny movements occur at the end of the current player's turn.

For example, if Carol has the Red Centralized Line Bunderground Station #03 - Smile End in her area of The Bunny Circle, then anytime that any player rolls a 3 on the Red die, Carol may move any bunny with an Oyster Cracker or Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier card from any position in The Bunny Circle onto Smile End. Of course, Smile End must be vacant to receive a new bunny.

A bunny on a Bunderground Station counts as a 'space' in The Bunny Circle. A bunny on a Bunderground Station may be directly targeted by any weapon, and weapons that affect adjacent bunnies can 'see' these bunnies. A player may move a bunny that is already on a Bunderground Station to a vacant Bunderground Station. All bunny movements occur at the end of the current player's turn.

For example, if Carol has the Red Centralized Line Bunderground Station #03 - Smile End in her area of The Bunny Circle, then anytime that any player rolls a 3 on the Red die, Carol may move any bunny with an Oyster Cracker or Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier card from any position in The Bunny Circle onto Smile End. Of course, Smile End must be vacant to receive a new bunny.

rules.title: Bunderground Station
rules.text:
When a Bundergound Station card is drawn, it is immediately placed into any player's area of The Bunny Circle. Usually a player will place it into his own area of The Bunny Circle, but a player may chose to place it into an opponent;'s area. A Bunderground Station does not count as a 'space' in The Bunny Circle, and weapons that affect adjacent bunnies to not 'see' a Bunderground Station. A Bunderground Station cannot be directly targeted by a weapon.

Every Bundergound Station has a color (or line) and a number. Each time that the die with the corresponding color is rolled, all players must check to see if a Bunderground Station located in their area of The Gunny Circle has the matching number. If it does, then the player may move any bunny with an Oyster Cracker or an Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier card from any position in The Bunny Circle and place it onto the matching (color and number) Bunderground Station.

A Bundergound Station must be vacant to receive a new bunny. A bunny already on a Bunderground Station cannot be exchanged for a new one. A bunny on a Bunderground Station counts as a 'space' in The Bunny Circle. A bunny on a Bunderground Station may be directly targeted by any weapon, and weapons that affect adjacent bunnies can 'see' these bunnies. A player may move a bunny that is already on a Bunderground Station to a vacant Bunderground Station. All bunny movements occur at the end of the current player's turn.

For example, if Carol has the Red Centralized Line Bunderground Station #03 - Smile End in her area of The Bunny Circle, then anytime that any player rolls a 3 on the Red die, Carol may move any bunny with an Oyster Cracker or Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier card from any position in The Bunny Circle onto Smile End. Of course, Smile End must be vacant to receive a new bunny.
